present.spanish: Me llamo Ana y soy de México.
present.english: My name is Ana and I'm from Mexico.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te llamas igual que tu abuelo.
present.english: You're named after your grandfather.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te llamás María, ¿verdad?
present.english: Your name is María, right?
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se llama Pedro y trabaja en el banco.
present.english: His name is Pedro and he works at the bank.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos llamamos por teléfono cada semana.
present.english: We call each other on the phone every week.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os llamáis hermanos pero sois primos.
present.english: You call yourselves brothers but you're cousins.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se llaman los gemelos más famosos de la ciudad.
present.english: They're called the most famous twins in the city.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

preterite.spanish: Me llamé enfermo y no fui a trabajar.
preterite.english: I called in sick and didn't go to work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te llamaste valiente después de saltar.
preterite.english: You called yourself brave after jumping.
preterite.subject: tú

preterite.spanish: Te llamaste la atención con ese vestido.
preterite.english: You drew attention to yourself with that dress.
preterite.subject: vos

preterite.spanish: Se llamó María en honor a su abuela.
preterite.english: She was named María in honor of her grandmother.
preterite.subject: él/ella/usted

preterite.spanish: Nos llamamos inmediatamente después del accidente.
preterite.english: We called each other immediately after the accident.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Os llamasteis cobardes por no participar.
preterite.english: You called yourselves cowards for not participating.
preterite.subject: vosotros

preterite.spanish: Se llamaron para coordinar la reunión.
preterite.english: They called each other to coordinate the meeting.
preterite.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

future.spanish: Me llamaré doctora cuando termine la carrera.
future.english: I will call myself doctor when I finish my degree.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te llamarás todos los días desde Europa.
future.english: You will call every day from Europe.
future.subject: tú

future.spanish: Te llamarás arrepentido si no vas.
future.english: You will regret it if you don't go.
future.subject: vos

future.spanish: Se llamará la nueva directora mañana.
future.english: The new director will be announced tomorrow.
future.subject: él/ella/usted

future.english: We will call each other as soon as we arrive.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Os llamaréis los campeones después de ganar.
future.english: You will call yourselves champions after winning.
future.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Se llamarán para confirmar los detalles.
future.english: They will call to confirm the details.
future.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Me levanto a las seis de la mañana.
present.english: I get up at six in the morning.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te levantas muy temprano para correr.
present.english: You get up very early to run.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te levantás con mucha energía cada día.
present.english: You wake up with lots of energy every day.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Se levanta cuando suena el despertador.
present.english: He/She gets up when the alarm goes off.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Nos levantamos juntos para desayunar.
present.english: We get up together to have breakfast.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Os levantáis muy tarde los fines de semana.
present.english: You all get up very late on weekends.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Se levantan antes del amanecer para trabajar.
present.english: They get up before dawn to work.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Veo las noticias todas las noches.
present.english: I watch the news every night.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Ves películas de terror sin miedo.
present.english: You watch horror movies without fear.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Ves series coreanas en Netflix.
present.english: You watch Korean series on Netflix.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Ve a sus amigos cada fin de semana.
present.english: He/She sees his/her friends every weekend.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Vemos el partido juntos en el bar.
present.english: We watch the game together at the bar.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Veis documentales sobre naturaleza.
present.english: You all watch nature documentaries.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Ven la televisión después de cenar.
present.english: They watch television after dinner.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Doy clases de español los martes.
present.english: I teach Spanish classes on Tuesdays.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Das muy buenos consejos a tus amigos.
present.english: You give very good advice to your friends.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Das lo mejor de vos en cada proyecto.
present.english: You give your best in every project.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Da dinero a organizaciones benéficas.
present.english: He/She gives money to charitable organizations.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Damos las gracias por todo lo recibido.
present.english: We give thanks for everything received.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Dais flores a vuestra madre cada domingo.
present.english: You all give flowers to your mother every Sunday.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Dan regalos generosos en Navidad.
present.english: They give generous gifts at Christmas.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Digo la verdad aunque duela.
present.english: I tell the truth even if it hurts.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Dices cosas muy inteligentes en las reuniones.
present.english: You say very intelligent things in meetings.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Decís exactamente lo que pensás.
present.english: You say exactly what you think.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Dice que viene mañana por la tarde.
present.english: He/She says he/she's coming tomorrow afternoon.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Decimos lo que sentimos sin miedo.
present.english: We say what we feel without fear.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Decís bromas muy divertidas en clase.
present.english: You all tell very funny jokes in class.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Dicen que el restaurante es excelente.
present.english: They say the restaurant is excellent.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes

present.spanish: Sé hablar cuatro idiomas con fluidez.
present.english: I know how to speak four languages fluently.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Sabes cocinar platos muy deliciosos.
present.english: You know how to cook very delicious dishes.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Sabés tocar la guitarra como un profesional.
present.english: You know how to play guitar like a professional.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Sabe la respuesta a todas las preguntas.
present.english: He/She knows the answer to all the questions.
present.subject: él/ella/usted

present.spanish: Sabemos el camino de memoria.
present.english: We know the way by heart.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Sabéis resolver problemas matemáticos complejos.
present.english: You all know how to solve complex math problems.
present.subject: vosotros

present.spanish: Saben tocar varios instrumentos musicales.
present.english: They know how to play various musical instruments.
present.subject: ellos/ellas/ustedes
